manuscript_citation: Gorostiza EA, Colomb J, Brembs B, A decision underlies phototaxis in an insect. Open Biology 6(12). doi: 10.1098/rsob.160229
guidelines: Original protocol written by Yasmine Graf.

components.data: Hatched flies of all test groups (e.g. wild type controls, experimental groups) are disposed of, in case their age is not controlled.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hatched flies of all test groups (e.g. wild type controls, experimental groups) are disposed of, in case their age is not controlled.

components.data: All  newly hatched flies from all vials of each test group are collected into one new ‘experimental’ vial each (“Exp.”). The flies are now 0 to 1 day old.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: All  newly hatched flies from all vials of each test group are collected into one new ‘experimental’ vial each (“Exp.”). The flies are now 0 to 1 day old.

components.data:
The  collected  flies from  the  day  before  become  anesthetized with  CO2  and  their wings are  shortened. It is important to  keep  the  flies anesthetized for no longer than 5 minutes. Therefore,  it is helpful to portion  the flies: They get transferred into an empty vial; from this vial smaller groups of flies can be transferred into another empty vial (via tube or funnel).

   

The single fly portions then get anesthetized by holding the vial upside down, inserting the CO2 pistol and fill in the CO2 for a few seconds (stop when all flies fall down onto the plug). Afterwards, the vial can be opened and the flies can be placed down the activated CO2 pad.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The  collected  flies from  the  day  before  become  anesthetized with  CO2  and  their wings are  shortened. It is important to  keep  the  flies anesthetized for no longer than 5 minutes. Therefore,  it is helpful to portion  the flies: They get transferred into an empty vial; from this vial smaller groups of flies can be transferred into another empty vial (via tube or funnel).

   

The single fly portions then get anesthetized by holding the vial upside down, inserting the CO2 pistol and fill in the CO2 for a few seconds (stop when all flies fall down onto the plug). Afterwards, the vial can be opened and the flies can be placed down the activated CO2 pad.

components.data: The single fly portions then get anesthetized by holding the vial upside down, inserting the CO2 pistol and fill in the CO2 for a few seconds (stop when all flies fall down onto the plug). Afterwards, the vial can be opened and the flies can be placed down the activated CO2 pad.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The single fly portions then get anesthetized by holding the vial upside down, inserting the CO2 pistol and fill in the CO2 for a few seconds (stop when all flies fall down onto the plug). Afterwards, the vial can be opened and the flies can be placed down the activated CO2 pad.

components.data: Flies need to be sorted in case the experiment is asking for distinct gender or stocks are balanced. The selected flies can be held by the forceps at the very tip of the wings. The wings need to be shortened to one third of their original length and straight through the crossing line of both wings. Too long wings can cause the fly to jump more often; cutting the wings too shortly can injure the fly. If the wings of a fly are spread into different directions it is still possible to cut them straightly, even if hitting the crossing line is more difficult.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Flies need to be sorted in case the experiment is asking for distinct gender or stocks are balanced. The selected flies can be held by the forceps at the very tip of the wings. The wings need to be shortened to one third of their original length and straight through the crossing line of both wings. Too long wings can cause the fly to jump more often; cutting the wings too shortly can injure the fly. If the wings of a fly are spread into different directions it is still possible to cut them straightly, even if hitting the crossing line is more difficult.

components.data: After cutting the wings the still anesthetized flies get transferred carefully to the now empty experimental vial by using a brush; following portions of wing clipped flies can be added the same way, as long as the work is done quickly enough.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After cutting the wings the still anesthetized flies get transferred carefully to the now empty experimental vial by using a brush; following portions of wing clipped flies can be added the same way, as long as the work is done quickly enough.

components.data: The vial with the freshly wing shortened flies needs to be set aside as long as flies recovered from anesthesia; sleeping flies fall down into the food and stick to it. The completely prepared flies are put back into the incubator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The vial with the freshly wing shortened flies needs to be set aside as long as flies recovered from anesthesia; sleeping flies fall down into the food and stick to it. The completely prepared flies are put back into the incubator.

components.data: Darken the room (close blinds and curtains, switch off lights).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Darken the room (close blinds and curtains, switch off lights).

components.data: Switch on the lights of the Buridan arena.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch on the lights of the Buridan arena.

components.data: Assemble the bottom of the arena such that the platform perfectly fits into the designated hole (the grommet must seal the hole perfectly).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Assemble the bottom of the arena such that the platform perfectly fits into the designated hole (the grommet must seal the hole perfectly).

components.data: Fit the bottom into the arena and make sure that the platform is straight in all directions (use water-level).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fit the bottom into the arena and make sure that the platform is straight in all directions (use water-level).

components.data: Check whether the camera is in a straight position above the arena (water level).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check whether the camera is in a straight position above the arena (water level).
Start the computer.
Start the program (Buritrack).
Choose “Main”.
Choose “New Video Capture”.

components.data: Choose the camera (if there is only one camera linked to the computer, leave the default camera number “0”).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Choose the camera (if there is only one camera linked to the computer, leave the default camera number “0”).

components.data: Adjust the camera such that the platform is clearly visible and the edge of the platform is not too dark but clearly visible as well, make sure that the “Auto Focus” is switched off and focus the platform manually in the web cam soft­ ware user surface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adjust the camera such that the platform is clearly visible and the edge of the platform is not too dark but clearly visible as well, make sure that the “Auto Focus” is switched off and focus the platform manually in the web cam soft­ ware user surface.

components.data: Use the function “Set Camera ROI” to check whether the dark stripes are in the exact north and south position of the platform: Therefore click left on “Set Camero ROI”; click left in the middle of the platform (if you misplaced the cursor, click right and choose “Set Camera ROI” again); move the cursor up to the north stripe and down to the south stripe (the edge of the square has to cross the stripe in the middle); move the stripes if necessary
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use the function “Set Camera ROI” to check whether the dark stripes are in the exact north and south position of the platform: Therefore click left on “Set Camero ROI”; click left in the middle of the platform (if you misplaced the cursor, click right and choose “Set Camera ROI” again); move the cursor up to the north stripe and down to the south stripe (the edge of the square has to cross the stripe in the middle); move the stripes if necessary

components.data: Fill in water (approx. 2,5 big fly vials per arena); the platform is supposed to be surrounded by a “wall” of water so that the fly cannot jump out of the platform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill in water (approx. 2,5 big fly vials per arena); the platform is supposed to be surrounded by a “wall” of water so that the fly cannot jump out of the platform.
Clean the platform with 70% Ethanol.

components.data: Choose a tight area around the platform which shall be recorded (“Set Camera  ROI”); the stripes or the edge of the arena are not supposed to be recorded.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Choose a tight area around the platform which shall be recorded (“Set Camera  ROI”); the stripes or the edge of the arena are not supposed to be recorded.

components.data: Choose “New Tracking” and browse for your destination folder then type in the name of your file (e.g. wa3.xml for wild type, arena A, sample size (3)). Fill in the group of your recording at “fly name” (e.g. wa for wild type, arena A). Choose the duration of your recording (e.g. 900 seconds) then click left on “Set Arena Size” and define the platform by choosing three points on the edge of the platform; the drawn circle has to perfectly cover the platform (if it does not, check whether the camera is really straight above the arena). An incorrectly set arena size will cause imprecise data! Choose “OK”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Choose “New Tracking” and browse for your destination folder then type in the name of your file (e.g. wa3.xml for wild type, arena A, sample size (3)). Fill in the group of your recording at “fly name” (e.g. wa for wild type, arena A). Choose the duration of your recording (e.g. 900 seconds) then click left on “Set Arena Size” and define the platform by choosing three points on the edge of the platform; the drawn circle has to perfectly cover the platform (if it does not, check whether the camera is really straight above the arena). An incorrectly set arena size will cause imprecise data! Choose “OK”.

components.data: If required, measure the temperature in the middle of the platform and document it.Transfer the fly to the platform by using a tube. Start the recording (“Activate Tracking”). The walking fly is now recorded by the program and its trace will be­ come visible as a red line. In the bottom right corner of the program’s window there is an “Info” box which shows the most important data: tracking (has to be “true” during the recording), time (has to run during the recording, otherwise the tracker stopped and the fly has to be put back to the platform), exp time (the time that was chosen before, e.g. 900 seconds = 15:00:00), frame (starts running as soon as the program is started), distance and speed (walking parameters which are directly ana­ lyzed) and bursts (-1 before the tracking is started; 0 as long as the fly didn’t jumped off the platform; one burst = one jump; when the tracker only runs for 5 minutes, the burst number has to be 0!)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If required, measure the temperature in the middle of the platform and document it.Transfer the fly to the platform by using a tube. Start the recording (“Activate Tracking”). The walking fly is now recorded by the program and its trace will be­ come visible as a red line. In the bottom right corner of the program’s window there is an “Info” box which shows the most important data: tracking (has to be “true” during the recording), time (has to run during the recording, otherwise the tracker stopped and the fly has to be put back to the platform), exp time (the time that was chosen before, e.g. 900 seconds = 15:00:00), frame (starts running as soon as the program is started), distance and speed (walking parameters which are directly ana­ lyzed) and bursts (-1 before the tracking is started; 0 as long as the fly didn’t jumped off the platform; one burst = one jump; when the tracker only runs for 5 minutes, the burst number has to be 0!)

The walking fly is now recorded by the program and its trace will be­ come visible as a red line. In the bottom right corner of the program’s window there is an “Info” box which shows the most important data: tracking (has to be “true” during the recording), time (has to run during the recording, otherwise the tracker stopped and the fly has to be put back to the platform), exp time (the time that was chosen before, e.g. 900 seconds = 15:00:00), frame (starts running as soon as the program is started), distance and speed (walking parameters which are directly ana­ lyzed) and bursts (-1 before the tracking is started; 0 as long as the fly didn’t jumped off the platform; one burst = one jump; when the tracker only runs for 5 minutes, the burst number has to be 0!)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the fly to the platform by using a tube. Start the recording (“Activate Tracking”). The walking fly is now recorded by the program and its trace will be­ come visible as a red line. In the bottom right corner of the program’s window there is an “Info” box which shows the most important data: tracking (has to be “true” during the recording), time (has to run during the recording, otherwise the tracker stopped and the fly has to be put back to the platform), exp time (the time that was chosen before, e.g. 900 seconds = 15:00:00), frame (starts running as soon as the program is started), distance and speed (walking parameters which are directly ana­ lyzed) and bursts (-1 before the tracking is started; 0 as long as the fly didn’t jumped off the platform; one burst = one jump; when the tracker only runs for 5 minutes, the burst number has to be 0!)

components.data: Whenever a fly jumps off the platform there will be a sound. For a 15-minute ex­periment it suffices to put the fly carefully back on the platform (brush) and press “Activate Tracking” again. For a 5-minute experiment it is necessary to start the recording all over again, therefore put the fly back on the platform and choose “New Tracking”; keep all of your settings, overwrite the existing file and choose “Activate Tracking” again.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Whenever a fly jumps off the platform there will be a sound. For a 15-minute ex­periment it suffices to put the fly carefully back on the platform (brush) and press “Activate Tracking” again. For a 5-minute experiment it is necessary to start the recording all over again, therefore put the fly back on the platform and choose “New Tracking”; keep all of your settings, overwrite the existing file and choose “Activate Tracking” again.

components.data: When the recording is done another sound will be audible. Check if the time is the same as the experimental time (and, for a 5-minute experiment, if the hurts num­ber is 0) and take the fly out (tube). Clean the platform with 70% Ethanol, rotate the platform and start a new recording.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When the recording is done another sound will be audible. Check if the time is the same as the experimental time (and, for a 5-minute experiment, if the hurts num­ber is 0) and take the fly out (tube). Clean the platform with 70% Ethanol, rotate the platform and start a new recording.

components.data: It is helpful for the later analysis of the data to write a .txt file while recording. Therefore generate a new .txt file and name it after the experiment (e.g. Mutant xy) then open it and note the exact file name (e.g. wa3.xml) with the file extension (.xml!!!) and write the group (e.g. wa), seprated by a tab from the file name. Do this step for every recording, such that each fly is assigned a filename and a group!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: It is helpful for the later analysis of the data to write a .txt file while recording. Therefore generate a new .txt file and name it after the experiment (e.g. Mutant xy) then open it and note the exact file name (e.g. wa3.xml) with the file extension (.xml!!!) and write the group (e.g. wa), seprated by a tab from the file name. Do this step for every recording, such that each fly is assigned a filename and a group!

components.data: If you use paper instead of a file, it is also necessary to write down the details of the recording (date, experimenter name, group, file name, possible treatment) to make sure that another experimenter will be able to reproduce the whole experiment.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If you use paper instead of a file, it is also necessary to write down the details of the recording (date, experimenter name, group, file name, possible treatment) to make sure that another experimenter will be able to reproduce the whole experiment.

components.data: After finishing the experiment clean the arena: Get out the water such that the are­na won’t get wet (pipetting), disassemble the bottom, and dry all pieces, especially the grommet. Clean the arena wall and the stripes carefully. Switch everything off (arena lights, air condition, and computer).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After finishing the experiment clean the arena: Get out the water such that the are­na won’t get wet (pipetting), disassemble the bottom, and dry all pieces, especially the grommet. Clean the arena wall and the stripes carefully. Switch everything off (arena lights, air condition, and computer).
